Comment: The problem statement is quite interesting. Could be one for the fastest mode.

It would be interesting to see if we can have an example where the sequence starts from a *efghi 
Solved in Typescript üëçüèª

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and clear for all.
Solved in c++

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and fun ^^

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was very clear, allowed for creativity blending a couple of js functions, and I was able to solve on my first try (representative of my skill level for code clashes).

Input
* Most of the description can be moved to Constraints section (see the relevant point below). For this section, please rewrite to something like this:

A string [[s]] of ordered characters with exactly one character replaced by {{*}}

Output
* Please change "ascii" to "ASCII".

* As there is exactly one * in each string, there is no sum or missing "characters" to speak of. Please revise the description.

Constraints
* Please change "s" to "length of [[s]]".

* Please state the constraint you put in Input section here:

First and last characters of [[s]] will always be an actual letter, and not an asterisk

Cases
* Each test should be similar to but different from its corresponding validator. Please revise the following pairs of cases accordingly:
   ‚Ä¢ Test 1 and Validator 1
   ‚Ä¢ Test 2 and Validator 2

Thanks.
thanks, I simplified it to not have the sum, thus some text was not accurate. Have updated that part and will also update the descriptions to be more clear.

All right.

Constraints
* Please change "s" to "length of [[s]]".

* Please add "in" before "[[s]]".

Thanks.
